---
title: "Comparing different methods"
date: last-modified
format:
    html:
        embed-resources: true
title-block-banner: true
bibliography: references.bib
---


-   We can use the networks that we built from the previous section and showcase how they (maybe) are giving way different metrics (telling different stories)

-   I think if we have multiple networks for different time points as well we can compare within and between network differences? (need to have a think on that)


::: {.cell}

:::


Plot things...


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(df) +
    geom_line(aes(x = as.numeric(as.factor(`id`)), 
                    y = stat_val, 
                    colour = model)) +
    geom_point(aes(x = as.numeric(as.factor(`id`)), 
                y = stat_val, 
                colour = model)) +
    facet_wrap(vars(stat),
                scales = 'free') +
    scale_size(guide = 'none') +
    theme_classic() +
    xlab("time") +
    ylab("value") +
    theme(panel.border = element_rect(colour = 'black',
                                      fill = "#ffffff00"),
            axis.text.x = element_blank(),
            axis.ticks.x = element_blank())
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Comparing the different structures that are recovered by the different models (colours) over a time series](08_compare_files/figure-html/fig-line-1.png){#fig-line width=672}
:::
:::
